DataElement.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale S28 Past Week Usual Severity Hair Loss Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation in the past week the severity of their hair loss, using a four-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale Past Week Usual Severity Hair Loss Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms._The most recent week, including today._A question about the usual severity of an individual's hair loss._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.

A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale Severity Score 4 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (Slight) to 4 (Very Severe) on a Likert scale used on the Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale questionnaire.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exceedingly intense or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

Concepts.definition: Exceedingly intense or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

Concepts.definition: Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Small or little in size, quantity, or degree.

Concepts.definition: Small or little in size, quantity, or degree.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.origin: MSAS-SF:Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale Short Form.Chang VT, et.al., Cancer. 2000 Sep 1;89(5):1162-71.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure.  The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents.  Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: How SEVERE was your hair loss
ReferenceDocuments.description: How SEVERE was your hair loss usually?

DataElement.origin: MSAS:Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale. Portenoy, RK, et.al. Eur J Cancer. 1994;30A(9):1326-36.
